授業目的: 英文欄参照/Refer to the following
到達目標: 英文欄参照/Refer to the following
授業方法:
2021 UPDATE: Most mandatory classes are expected to be conducted face-to-face (at least 50% of the lessons will be in person) for the Fall 2021 semester. A Google Classroom site will be used for most course information and assignment submissions, and also for any outside of class contact with the teacher. Email the teacher at mjchang@kwansei.ac.jp to get the Google Classroom site code to register. This course is centered mainly on discussions based on the textbook and test-taking skill topics. This is an interactive style course, it requires interactive English only discussions with classmates every lesson.
<Information for students permitted to take classes online>
Sessions will be held simultaneously via Zoom (meeting code will be posted on the Google Classroom site). Session 1 will be face-to-face. Lesson details will be updated on the Google Classroom site by 5:30 pm the day before our class time (Mondays). Email the teacher at mjchang@kwansei.ac.jp to get the Google Classroom site code to register.
*If the pandemic situation changes in September - October and we need to have the sessions online, students can check the Google Classroom site for teacher updated information and students may also be contacted individually by their KGU e-mail addresses to explain about online classes if on campus face-to-face classes are not possible for the Fall 2021 semester.
**If classes are to be held online, all classes will be live using Zoom for synchronous style classes via Zoom.

Classes will include discussions, presentations, pair work and group work. Assignments may require the use of a computer and online sites.

第33回: Course sessions listed above are subject to change in accordance to student needs, any changes to the university calendar, and any external situation affecting the university.

The purpose of this course is for students to develop their English language knowledge (vocabulary, grammar, and discourse) and language skills (listening, speaking, reading, and writing) within an all-English communicative environment to enable them to meet the academic requirements of study abroad programs.

name: 【200】インテンシブ・イングリッシュ　１５／Intensive English
